file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-26-02-04 - CONFIG-2 - RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the RH wardrobe assembly. B. The RH wardrobe is installed in the passenger cabin, at zone 232. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH RH 25-26-02-000-802-A RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL WARDROBE AIRCRAFT WITH RH 25-26-02-400-802-A RH WARDROBE - INSTALLATION WARDROBE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-26-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-02-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE 2. RH WARDROBE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the RH wardrobe assembly. (2) The RH wardrobe is installed in the passenger cabin, at zone 232. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 35-20-08-000-801-A/400 - SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Gloves To prevent damage 2 pairs available Commercially Shoe covers To prevent damage 2 pairs available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-010-A CAUTION: USE GLOVES AND SHOE COVERS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE RH wardrobe AND CARPET. (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Make sure that the RH wardrobe is empty. (3) Remove the main-door curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400). (4) Remove the main-door region ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400). (5) Remove the passenger oxygen cylinder pressure (AMM TASK 35-20-08-000-801-A/ 400). (6) Remove the sealant from the interface of the RH wardrobe bottom edge with the floor (SRM 51-20-01). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-012-B (1) Remove the RH wardrobe closeout panel (4). Refer to DET. A. (2) Open the doors (3) of the RH wardrobe (1). Refer to DET. A. (3) Remove the screws (18) that attach the floor fitting covers (17). Refer to DET. D. (4) Remove the floor fitting covers (17). (5) Remove the bolts (19) and washers (20) that attach the RH wardrobe (1) to the floor. Refer to DET. D. (6) Remove the screws (14) that attach the access panel (13). Refer to VIEW C. (7) Remove the access panel (13). (8) Remove the bolts (16) and washers (15) that attach the RH wardrobe (1) to the aircraft structure. Refer to VIEW C. (9) Close the doors (3) of the RH wardrobe (1). (10) Open the miscellaneous compartment door (2). Refer to DET. A. (11) Remove the screws (12) that attach the access plate (11). Refer to VIEW B. (12) Remove the bolt (10), washers (9) and (7), and nut (8) to that attach the tie rod (6) to the aircraft structure. Refer to DET. A. (13) Release the tie rod (6) from the aircraft structure. (14) Close the miscellaneous compartment door (2). (15) Remove the RH wardrobe (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE RH Wardrobe - Removal/Installation Figure 401 1. RH WARDROBE AIRCRAFT A ZONE STRUCTURE (REF.) 9. WASHER 232 10. BOLT 8. NUT 2. MISCELLANEOUS 7. WASHER DOOR 6. TIE ROD 5. SUPPORT PASSENGER OXYGEN 3. DOOR CYLINDER (REF.) B 17. FLOOR FITTING COVER 18. SCREW C 2 19. BOLT 20. WASHER DET. D 1 DET. A D 2 4. RH WARDROBE CLOSEOUT PANEL 16. BOLT 15. WASHER 11. ACCESS PLATE 13. ACCESS PANEL AIRCRAFT STRUCTURE (REF.) VIEW C 14. SCREW 1 SEALANT RTV 780 12. SCREW VIEW B 2 145AMM251630.MCE A TORQUE: 13.6 - 16.4 N.m. (120 - 145 lb.in.) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-02-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH RH WARDROBE 3. RH WARDROBE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the RH wardrobe assembly. (2) The RH wardrobe is installed in the passenger cabin, at zone 232. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 35-20-08-400-801-A/400 - SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Gloves To prevent damage 2 pairs available Commercially Shoe covers To prevent damage 2 pairs available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV 780 (Black) Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-012-B CAUTION: USE GLOVES AND SHOE COVERS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE RH wardrobe AND CARPET. (1) Put the RH wardrobe (1) in its installation position. (2) Open the doors (3) of the RH wardrobe (1). (3) Attach the RH wardrobe (1) to the aircraft structure with the bolts (16) and washers (15). Refer to VIEW C. (4) Attach the RH wardrobe (1) to the floor with the bolts (19) and washers (20). Refer to DET. D. (5) Install the floor fitting covers (17) with the screws (18). Refer to DET. D. (6) Install the access panel (13) with the screws (14). Refer to VIEW C. (7) Close the doors (3) of the RH wardrobe (1). (8) Open the miscellaneous compartment door (2). (9) Install the bolt (10), washers (9) and (7), and nut (8) to attach the tie rod (6) to the aircraft structure. Refer to DET. A. (10) Install the access plate (11) with the screws (12). Refer to VIEW B. (11) Close the miscellaneous compartment door (2). (12) Install the RH wardrobe closeout panel (4). Refer to DET. A. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-010-B (1) Apply the sealant to the interface of the RH wardrobe bottom edge with the floor (SRM 51-20-01). (2) Install the passenger oxygen cylinder pressure (AMM TASK 35-20-08-400-801-A/400). (3) Install the main-door region ceiling panel (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400). (4) Install the main-door curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
